ACT
63
Revocation of the executor of the will
The court may, at the proposal of a party or ex officio, recall the executor of the will, if his work is not in accordance with the will of the testator or with the law.
In the decision on revocation, the court will oblige the executor of the will to submit a certificate of his capacity and powers within 24 hours. No appeal is allowed against the decision on the recall of the executor of the will.
The revoked executor of the will is obliged to return to the court a certificate of his capacity and powers without delay, otherwise he is responsible for all damages that would arise from it.
The revoked executor of the will is responsible for all damages that would result from the actions that he would perform as the executor of the will after the revocation.
